pyarcade.blackjack_players module¶

class pyarcade.blackjack_players.BlackJackWinner¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Represents the winner of a blackjack round

“PLAYER” - player.

“DEALER” - dealer.

DEALER = 'Dealer'¶
PLAYER = 'Player'¶

True if game has been won False otherwise.

Checks if a player has won diagonally. (y = x).

Returns:

True if game has been won False otherwise.

True if game has been won False otherwise.

Returns:

pyarcade.connect4_states module¶

class pyarcade.connect4_states.C4State¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Represents the state of each slot on the board

“E” - Empty slot

“X” - Player X occupies slot

“O” - Player O occupies slot

E = '-'¶
O = 'O'¶
X = 'X'¶

pyarcade.difficulties module¶

class pyarcade.difficulties.Difficulty¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Represents the game difficulty.

EASY - Easy game mode.

NORMAL - Default game mode.

HARD - Hard game mode.

EASY = 'Easy'¶
HARD = 'Hard'¶
NORMAL = 'Normal'¶

pyarcade.eval_input module¶

class pyarcade.eval_input.Evaluation¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Represents the evaluation of each digit for sequence guessing.

INCORRECT - Nowhere in 4 the hidden sequence at all

SOMEWHERE - Somewhere in the hidden sequence, but not in the location it was submitted

CORRECT - Is in the hidden sequence at the location it was submitted.

CORRECT = 'Correct'¶
INCORRECT = 'Incorrect'¶
SOMEWHERE = 'Somewhere'¶

pyarcade.input_system module¶

class pyarcade.input_system.InputSystem(game: pyarcade.game_option.Game = <Game.MASTERMIND: 'Mastermind'>, difficulty=<Difficulty.NORMAL: 'Normal'>)¶

Bases: object

Represents input system for validation and game usage. And executes commands on user input.

clear()¶

Clear the all game history.

get_last_guess() → Union[str, Tuple[Tuple[str, str], bool]]¶

Retrieves the player’s last move/guess.

Returns:

List[Tuple[int, str]]: The evaluation of last guess (mastermind). List[List[str]]: Board state of last move (connect4).

get_round_info() → str¶

Gets the round information. If game is Mastermind, return round number If game is Connect4, return the current player’s turn

Returns:

round_info (str)

is_valid_input_for_game(cmd: str) → bool¶

Determines if cmd is valid for the current game instance.

Args:

cmd (str): User’s input.

Returns:

True if valid for current game.

make_guess_for_game(cmd: str) → bool¶

Make a guess based on current game.

Args:

cmd: (str) user’s guess list.

Returns:

True if correct according to the game, False otherwise.

reset()¶

Resets the current game to starting state.

take_input(cmd: str) → Tuple[bool, bool]¶

Takes in a user’s input and interacts with mastermind accordingly.

Args:

cmd: (string) user’s command.

Returns:

A 2-tuple boolean representing (win, valid_cmd).

win (bool): True iff correct sequence was guessed. valid_cmd (bool): True iff a valid cmd was inputted.

clear_game()¶

static compare_to(card_one: (<enum 'Ranks'>, <enum 'Suits'>), card_two: (<enum 'Ranks'>, <enum 'Suits'>)) → int¶
Args:

card_one: Player one card. card_two: Player two card.

Returns:

Positive number if player one wins turn, negative if player two wins turn, zero if there is a war.

static deal_hands(deck: [(<enum 'Ranks'>, <enum 'Suits'>)]) -> ([(<enum 'Ranks'>, <enum 'Suits'>)], [(<enum 'Ranks'>, <enum 'Suits'>)])¶
Args:

deck: Deck which cards will be dealt.

Returns:

Two lists of 26 cards.

Args:

cmd: “Flip Card”

Returns:

Outcome of turn. (False if there is a winner)

Returns:

Returns:

New deck of cards.

get_last_turn() -> (<class 'str'>, <class 'str'>, <class 'int'>, <class 'int'>, <class 'bool'>, <class 'int'>)¶
Returns:

A Tuple containing: str: Player One’s card. str: Player Two’s card. int: Number of cards Player One has. int: Number of cards Player Two has. bool: Returns True if there is a winner, False otherwise. int: 1 or 2 depending on who won last turn.

update_current_history()¶

Adds each player’s hand and previous turn winner to current history.

update_entire_history()¶

Adds winner of game, and current history, to entire history.

war(pile: [(<enum 'Ranks'>, <enum 'Suits'>)]) → bool¶

Case where turn results in a war. Each player adds 3 additional cards to the pile before playing a new turn.

Args:

pile: Cards to be given to winner of turn.

Returns:

Recursive call to play_turn with an updated pile.
